name: nonexistential
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not relating to existence or being alive: The verb "to be" in these sentences has a nonexistential meaning. Although a serious problem, it represents a nonexistential threat.
More examplesFewer examplesPandemics force us to consider which risks are existential to humanity and which are nonexistential.There are large classes of non-existential facts that can have an explanation and hence do have an explanation.The cabinet were given a detailed report on the situation and assessed the threat as being nonexistential.
